head.title: In Northern Ireland, The Next Challenge

hedline.hl1: In Northern Ireland, The Next Challenge

abstract.p: Daniel J Donovan letter on May 7 article urges people of Northern Ireland to back more tolerant and open society

block.p: ''In Breakthrough, I.R.A. Will Allow Arms Inspections'' (front page, May 7) reports a welcome step toward the full carrying out of the Good Friday peace accord for Northern Ireland. This decision allows for the resumption of the movement to a new society in Ulster. The people there recognize the possibilities available in other societies and seek the benefits and stability of the modern world that have been too long denied that troubled land.
They realize that changes are necessary to achieve these goals.

''In Breakthrough, I.R.A. Will Allow Arms Inspections'' (front page, May 7) reports a welcome step toward the full carrying out of the Good Friday peace accord for Northern Ireland. This decision allows for the resumption of the movement to a new society in Ulster. The people there recognize the possibilities available in other societies and seek the benefits and stability of the modern world that have been too long denied that troubled land.
They realize that changes are necessary to achieve these goals.

Hope is the forward-looking vision of the human soul, and hope has sustained the people of the North through decades of conflict. They can expand the parameters of their lives, removing the obstacles to personal and community development imposed by a bitter legacy, by accepting the challenge to support a more tolerant and open society.
